channel.title: Please Help?
channel.description:
Hey, I'm using Duh Pk v2 and i click Run and it says Server is running On Port 43594 then i try to log on to my server and it says Error connecting to server? Is this something to do with my No-ip or something?
Thanks
Boulton123

item.title: Please Help?
item.dc:creator: @boulton123 boulton123
item.description:
@boulton123 wrote:

Username: I Jake i
Password: ******
Server: Jakescape.no-ip.org
Port: 43594

Is that Correct? :S[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 26, 2007, 11:43:47 AM[/size][hr]Someone Help Please XD

item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“boulton123, post:6, topic:160890”]public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594; //43594=default

Thats the code i got.[/quote]

Urrh, make sure the client port is correct?

item.title: Please Help?
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

boulton123:

I Dont get ya :s, How i put the Port on the Right Number :s

u gow intwo sherve.juva den serch 4

	public static int serverlistenerPort =

and den der shud be a numba and den chnge da numba 2 da numba u wnt jor port 2 be and ta da ur sherver is wrken!

Go to server.java. Search for…

	public static int serverlistenerPort =

The numbers after the ‘=’ sign, should be your port number to the server.

I.E: 43594, 5555.

Those are the common port numbers. Change that number to the port number of your choice.

	public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594;

If you chose 43594, thats how it would look.

Save > Compile > Run.

Also, in your client, if your using silab’s client. Make sure the port is the correct number.

I.E: You might have 5555, instead of 43594.

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 26, 2007, 10:44:24 AM[/size][hr][quote=“M00 M00 Pk, post:4, topic:160890”][quote author=X-J-K-X link=topic=218934.msg1900544#msg1900544 date=1196113010]

Hey, I’m using Duh Pk v2 and i click Run and it says Server is running On Port 43594 then i try to log on to my server and it says Error connecting to server? Is this something to do with my No-ip or something?

Thanks

Boulton123

nono u gots 2 put da port on da rite numba i had dis problim aswlel
[/quote]

JK, learn how to spell;

Ok First;
Make sure your no ip is running.
Also make sure you did’nt set the port to 5555, Test that port aswell, just to be sure.[/quote]

Lol i can spell, i was just being a kokokokokokok

Read full topic
